TITLE: NestCast - Podcast Hosting for Everyone
KEYWORDS: nestcast podcast hosting rss feed spotify
DESCRIPTION: We host your podcast at a much lower price than other hosting companies. This allows you to keep your podcast available for a long time.

INTRO.subTitle: The best hosting for your podcast
INTRO.title: Host your Podcast with NestCast
INTRO.buttonText: I want to join the waiting list
text: Nestcast helps you distribute your podcast quickly and easily to Spotify, Apple Podcasts, Podimo, and all other smaller podcast platforms. We ensure that your podcast is made available using an RSS feed, the format for making podcasts available on platforms such as Spotify and Apple Podcasts.

Nestcast is able to provide the best podcast service at a competitive price. We achieve this through the use of AI and machine learning. Our revolutionary platform is maintained by a small team, keeping our costs low.

SNIPPET_RIGHT.title: Podcast Hosting & RSS
text: To host a podcast, it is necessary to make your audio files available on a server and generate an RSS feed that indicates which episodes are available. This RSS feed is used by podcast platforms such as Spotify and Apple Podcasts to make your podcast available to listeners.
There are many companies that focus on podcast hosting, but NestCast is the only one that focuses solely on hosting and distributing podcasts. This is why we are the best at what we do.

We use the latest techniques and services to achieve the highest service level possible at a low price. We work with Angular 16, NestJs, and MongoDB. This ensures that we can provide a fast and reliable service. Our developers are constantly working on innovation and improving our service, ensuring you always have a state-of-the-art product.

SNIPPET_LEFT.title: Podcast Platforms
text: Spotify, Amazon Music, Samsung Podcasts, Podcast Index, Listen Notes, Apple Podcasts, Google Podcasts, Pandora, Tune In, iHeartRadio, Deezer. These are just a few of the platforms on which we can make your podcast available. We ensure that your podcast is available to as many listeners as possible.
The RSS feed that we make available for your podcast is designed so that it can be used by all platforms. You have optimal control over how your podcast is displayed on different platforms.

INTRO.subTitle: The technology behind NestCast
INTRO.title: About NestCast
text: NestCast is born out of a passion for podcasts and technology. Our founder, Joris Pieters, has been creating podcasts for years. He created the popular podcast "B&Gay full of Love" about the adventures of the candidates of the program "B&B Full of Love".

With knowledge of podcasts combined with a background as a Full Stack Developer, it became possible to create a high-tech platform for podcast hosting. As AI and machine learning play an increasingly important role in technology today, NestCast is also a product that uses these techniques. With this, we hope to innovate even faster.

WORD.subTitle: The technology behind NestCast
WORD.title: Word from the founder
text: NestCast started as a side project. Like many developers who truly love their craft, ideas for creating a new product constantly arise. Over the years, many ideas have been considered, but with NestCast, it was clear that this product had to be put into production.

As a freelance developer, it is important to have a good portfolio. NestCast was initially a showcase, but as you seriously engage with it, enthusiasm grows. Each milestone gives a very satisfying feeling, and this feeling is crucial when your work is also your passion.

NestCast will make the code open-source wherever possible. In other words, we prioritize security and privacy, but we also want to share our knowledge with other developers and show how we think about good solutions.
Joris Pieters

TECHNIQUES.title: Techniques
text: We use the latest techniques and services to achieve the highest possible service level. The user will mainly see the front end of our application to manage and distribute their podcast. For this, we have developed a SPA, which stands for Single Page Application. In the user experience, this is reflected in an application that works without page refreshes during use.

stack.title: Tech Stack
text: NestCast uses Angular to provide a modern user experience. Angular is a framework maintained by Google. TypeScript is used for programming within the framework. In our backend, we use Nest.js, a backend framework that uses Node, and TypeScript is also the programming language. Nest has structured itself largely based on Angular.

items.title: NgRx
items.text: State management for Angular based on Redux

items.title: NestJs
items.text: NodeJS backend framework based on the module structure of Angular

items.title: NodeJs
items.text: The framework that made server-side JavaScript possible

items.title: TypeScript
items.text: A layer on top of JavaScript to provide type safety

stack.title: Automated Tests
text: To increase the quality of our software and keep costs low, automated tests are essential. We use various types of tests to ensure the quality of our software.

items.title: Jest
items.text: Jest is a JavaScript testing framework designed to ensure the correctness of any JavaScript codebase.

items.title: Spectator
items.text: A layer on the Angular testing framework to simplify testing Angular components

items.title: Cypress
items.text: An end-to-end testing framework for web applications. It is built on top of Mocha, Chai, and Sinon.

stack.title: Services
text: To host our application and distribute your podcast, we use various services, all of which are cloud services. This means that we do not have our own servers and that we use the servers of the providers of these services. This ensures that we do not need to maintain our servers and that we can always use the latest technologies.

items.title: MongoDB
items.text: A NoSQL database that we use to store the data of your podcast.

items.title: GitHub
items.text: This is an online service to manage and share our code with other developers.

items.title: GitHub Actions
items.text: Automatically deploy software using GitHub Actions pipelines.

stack.title: Cloud Services
text: Hosting web applications and APIs is a specialized field. We use various cloud services to host our application and make your podcast available. Our cloud provider is AWS, Amazon Web Services. AWS is the largest cloud provider in the world and offers a wide range of services.

items.title: AWS

items.title: AWS S3
items.text: S3 is the storage service of AWS. We use S3 to store the audio files of your podcast.

items.title: AWS Lambda
items.text: AWS Lambda is a serverless computing service that executes code in response to events and automatically scales the required computing resources.

items.title: Serverless
items.text: Serverless is a framework that allows the development and deployment of serverless applications, for example, on AWS Lambda.

INTRO.subTitle: The highest price quality
INTRO.title: Subscriptions
INTRO.buttonText: I want to join the waiting list
text: Our subscriptions will have a low price for both business and private customers. We focus especially on customers who consider it important to have their podcast available and keep it available.

To keep your podcast available, it is especially important that the price is not too high. Once the listeners decrease, it is sometimes no longer profitable to keep your podcast available. We ensure that your podcast remains available at a low price.

SNIPPET_RIGHT.title: Personal subscription
text: For the hobbyist or the aspiring podcaster, the personal subscription is a good choice. You can host all your episodes and make them available on all major platforms. You have access to an extensive management console where you can manage your podcast and view statistics.
Companies have a lot of content that may not be very current but is important to have available. NestCast helps these companies keep their content available without unnecessary high costs.

SNIPPET_LEFT.subTitle: The highest price quality
SNIPPET_LEFT.title: Business subscriptions
text: For our business customers, we have a similar subscription as for our private customers. The difference lies in the billing. With a business subscription, the invoice is issued in the name of the company.

To keep your podcast available, it is especially important that the price is not too high. Once the listeners decrease, it is sometimes no longer profitable to keep your podcast available. We ensure that your podcast remains available at a low price.

PRICING.title: Subscriptions
text: From early 2024, two subscriptions will be available at a comparable price. A business subscription and a private subscription. The subscriptions are available with a so-called fair use policy. If the use of your podcast exceeds a certain limit, a surcharge will be charged. This surcharge depends on the number of listeners and the duration of the podcast.

INTRO.subTitle: How are you?
INTRO.title: Contact with NestCast
text: NestCast is a company that aims to be open to customers, technical talent, and colleagues in the podcast hosting field. Just like a part of our software is open source, we are an open book.

We are always looking for new customers, but also for new colleagues. Are you a developer and want to work on an innovative product? Then contact us. If you have feedback on our product, we'd also love to hear it.

text: NestCast is a Dutch company, and we are proud of that. Amsterdam is full of IT talent and has an excellent startup climate. Amsterdam is also the podcast capital of the Netherlands. We are proud to have our company here. Our office is located in Amsterdam West, Bos en Lommer.
